intro: Sandoricum beccarianum, commonly known as the Beccarian sandoricum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
